model.name: rest
model.title: Rest
model.description: Defines a rest service using the rest-dsl
model.label: rest

path.description: Path of the rest service, such as /foo

tag.description: To configure a special tag for the operations within this rest definition.

consumes.description: To define the content type what the REST service consumes (accept as input), such as application/xml or application/json. This option will override what may be configured on a parent level

produces.description: To define the content type what the REST service produces (uses for output), such as application/xml or application/json This option will override what may be configured on a parent level

bindingMode.description: Sets the binding mode to use. This option will override what may be configured on a parent level The default value is auto

skipBindingOnErrorCode.description: Whether to skip binding on output if there is a custom HTTP error code header. This allows to build custom error messages that do not bind to json / xml etc, as success messages otherwise will do. This option will override what may be configured on a parent level

clientRequestValidation.description: Whether to enable validation of the client request to check whether the Content-Type and Accept headers from the client is supported by the Rest-DSL configuration of its consumes/produces settings. This can be turned on, to enable this check. In case of validation error, then HTTP Status codes 415 or 406 is returned. The default value is false.

enableCORS.description: Whether to enable CORS headers in the HTTP response. This option will override what may be configured on a parent level The default value is false.

apiDocs.description: Whether to include or exclude the VerbDefinition in API documentation. This option will override what may be configured on a parent level The default value is true.

securityDefinitions.description: Sets the security definitions such as Basic, OAuth2 etc.

id.description: Sets the id of this node

description.description: Sets the description of this node
